titles: Poor Robins observations upon Whitsun-holidays. Concerning the fair and foul weather happening thereon. Together with the manly exercise of the Cornish-men of hurling the ball in Hide-Park on Whitsun-Tuesday last.
notes: Date of publication suggested by Wing.
Verse: "VVHat ails ye o ye clouds why do you frown ..."
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
keywords: Storms --  England --  London --  Poetry --  Early works to 1800.
